testcase.name: should accept valid email format: user@domain.com
should accept valid email format: user.name@domain.com
should accept valid email format: user-name@domain.com
should accept valid email format: user_name@domain.com
should accept valid email format: user123@domain.com
should accept valid email format: user@sub.domain.com
should accept valid email format: user@domain.co.uk
should reject invalid email format (starts with dot): .user@domain.com
should reject invalid email format (ends with dot): user.@domain.com
should reject invalid email format (dot after @): user@.domain.com
should reject invalid email format (consecutive dots): user@domain..com
should reject invalid email format (single-letter TLD): user@domain.c
should reject invalid email format (numeric TLD): user@domain.123
should reject invalid email format (domain starts with hyphen): user@-domain.com
should reject invalid email format (domain ends with hyphen): user@domain-.com
should reject invalid email format (missing username): @domain.com
should reject invalid email format (missing domain): user@.com
should reject invalid email format (missing @): user.domain.com
should reject invalid email format (multiple @): user@@domain.com
should reject invalid email format (missing TLD): user@domain
should prevent form submission with invalid email

should reject invalid email format (missing domain): user@.com
should reject invalid email format (missing @): user.domain.com
should reject invalid email format (multiple @): user@@domain.com
should reject invalid email format (missing TLD): user@domain
should reject requests with missing required fields
should handle email service errors
